definition: to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially

sentences.english: Nocturnal insects such as moths wouldn't need such large goblets to be lured over.
sentences.chinese: 勾引飛蛾一類的食彌昆蟲根本不需要如此大費周章。

sentences.english: In practice the transition might have been messy.
sentences.chinese: 但實踐中，這種轉變大費周章。

sentences.english: Is that person in the bed next to you worth the trouble?
sentences.chinese: 睡在你身邊的人值得你去大費周章嗎？

sentences.english: "But, Dupin, " I said, "why did you go to the trouble of replacing the letter?Why not just take it and leave?
sentences.chinese: 你爲何大費周章去替換那信，爲什麼不直接拿走呢？
